alert.note: Alert for Allen; Evangeline; Northern Acadia; Northern Jefferson Davis; St. Landry (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lake Charles (Southeast Texas and Southwest Louisiana)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 05 at 4:01AM CDT by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Jefferson Davis, southern Evangeline, northern Acadia, central St. Landry and southeastern Allen Parishes through 430 AM CDT... At 401 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Eunice, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Opelousas, Eunice, Ville Platte, Church Point, Mamou, Basile, Sunset, Washington, Grand Coteau, Chataignier, Prairie Ronde, Savoy, Duralde, Lawtell, Swords, Richard and Grand Prairie. This includes Interstate 49 between mile markers 12 and 26, and between mile markers 28 and 38. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Allen; Evangeline; Northern Acadia; Northern Jefferson Davis; St. Landry
